docs.snippet: A Queens man claimed to specialize in overturning wrongful convictions. He took people’s money, prosecutors said, but never did the legal work.

headline.print_headline: Indictment Alleges Queens Man Defrauded Convicts, Exploiting Hopes for Release
headline.main: Swindler Exploits the ‘Hope of Inmates,’ Prosecutor Says

docs.snippet: Cryptocurrencies and blockchain were meant to be great equalizers. Instead, women are finding that the gold rush is already stacked against them.

headline.main: Women in Cryptocurrencies Push Back Against ‘Blockchain Bros’

docs.snippet: One tiny election, one obsessed chief executive.
Andy Richter photographed around the world to present a diverse look at an ancient practice.
Drew Houston, chief executive of Dropbox, is set to become a member of a small club of entrepreneurs who steered a start-up through to the public markets.

headline.print_headline: At Dropbox, From an Idea To the Market
headline.main: Dropbox Chief to Join Elite Ranks of Idea-to-I.P.O. Founders

docs.snippet: Marketers are increasingly concerned that too many of the influencers they pay to push their products are actually followed by a percentage of accounts that are fake.

headline.print_headline: Marketers At Last Reckon With the Bots
headline.main: Uncovering Instagram Bots With a New Kind of Detective Work

docs.snippet: Reading by and for the 21st-century woman, from beyond the Western canon.

headline.main: Dear Match Book: I’m Starting an International Feminist Book Club

docs.snippet: The cocktail world is rediscovering a juice that was largely sidelined to the tiki bar.

headline.print_headline: Pineapple, a Spiky Outsider, Is Now a Regular at the Bar
headline.main: Pineapple, a Spiky Outsider, Is Now a Regular at the Bar

docs.snippet: Myanmar continues to kill its Rohingya, now by denying them health care and sometimes food instead of by wielding machetes and firing bullets.

headline.print_headline: I Saw a Genocide in Slow Motion
headline.main: I Saw a Genocide in Slow Motion
